VWO — Multi-Page Test
A short explainer + interactive demo

One experiment across multiple pages (Product → Cart → Checkout) with per-page changes and unified reporting.

The Problem (Why)

Separate A/B tests per page break the customer journey. You can't keep a visitor in the same variation across pages, apply per-page rules easily, or get a single funnel report.

  • Hard to apply different changes on each step while keeping one experiment.
  • Audience targeting per page (e.g., only show cart offer to users with items) is complex.
  • Reporting across the funnel is fragmented.

The Solution (What)

Multi-Page Test: One experiment covering all steps of the funnel.

  • One Test, One Experience: variation stickiness across pages.
  • Per-Page Flexibility: different changes, rules, triggers per page group.
  • Unified Reporting: consolidated funnel metrics in one report.

How it works (simplified)

  1. Visitor enters at Product page → assigned to a variation.
  2. Assignment is stored (sticky) — same variation travels to Cart & Checkout.
  3. Each page group can have its own edits and audience rules.
  4. Interactions are collected under one experiment for final analysis.

Benefits

  • Accurate funnel measurement
  • Less overhead — single experiment, fewer configurations
  • Better segmentation per page and per audience
  • Faster insights and higher confidence

Interactive Demo

Simulate a single visitor moving across three pages. Assign a variation and watch unified reporting update.

Visitor Variation: —
(no page)
Navigate to a page to view variation content
—

Unified Report

Visitors assigned

Conversion A: 0

Conversions (checkout clicks)

Variation B: 0

Visitors assigned

Conversion B: 0

Conversions (checkout clicks)

Tip: In VWO this stickiness is handled with target assignment + cross-page visitor ID; here we use localStorage to simulate that behaviour.
Demo simulates behavior only — not connected to VWO. Use this as an educational mockup.
